data.title: Update windows.md
data.body: Windows 10 instructions

data.title: Document that Windows 10 is supported
data.body: Does not say Windows 10 on OS Support It seems to work well on my Windows 10 laptop

data.title: Fix install on a symlinked $INSTALL_DIR/bin
data.body:
The installation script `script/grub install --install-dir $INSTALL_DIR`
is broken on linux machines if `$INSTALL_DIR/bin` happens to be a
symlinked folder.

This PR fixes the installation task `build/tasks/install-task.coffee`
and the launching script `atom.sh` to allow for symlinked folders.

data.title: The atom.notifications.getNotifications().length only growing
data.body:
If I add periodically (or by multiple invoke of plugin) some of notifications, 
after those got automatically removed (not seen anymore) from UI , 
the `atom.notifications.getNotifications().length` does not changes it size.

So I can see its only growing. 

atom 1.0.7

data.title: San Francisco font on El Capitan Beta
data.body:
This PR adds support for the bundled system font (San Francisco) that ships in El Capitan **Beta**.

The font stack will be:
1. `.SFNSText-Regular`: San Francisco on OS X El Capitan **Beta**.
2. `SF UI Text`: San Francisco on OS X when the downloaded version is installed.
3. `Lucida Grande`: <= OS X Yosemite.
4. `Segoe UI`: Windows
5. `Ubuntu`: Linux (Ubuntu)
6. `Cantarell, sans-serif`: Fallback

Closes #8594

**Note**: Most themes will override the `@font-family` variable, but still good to add as "default".

data.title: Soft Wrap in Japanese
data.body:
On Mac OS X 10.10.3

With the `Soft Wrap` option turned on, lines containing **Japanese character** are **not wrapped correctly**, leaving approximately 14 characters out of view. Seems to occur regardless of the window size.

![screen shot 2015-09-01 at 13 37 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3440771/9596362/b9f13192-50ae-11e5-830f-98c59d9696d0.png)

data.title: Atom clashes with Gulp
data.body:
I get the following error when I have Atom open:

```
$ gulp serve
[23:00:42] Using gulpfile gulpfile.js
[23:00:42] Starting 'build'...
[23:00:42] Starting 'clean'...
[23:00:42] Finished 'clean' after 114 ms
[23:00:42] Starting 'build-system'...
[23:00:42] Starting 'build-html'...

events.js:85
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
            ^
Error: EPERM, stat 'dist\app.html'
    at Error (native)
```

As soon as I close Atom it works fine. I think this error may interfere with other CLI tools.

I'm developing on windows.

data.title: Clicking (not dragging) starts highlighting text
data.body:
On Ubuntu 15.04 (which is not on VM), clicking on Atom starts highlighting text.  This problem occurs on Atom 1.0.8 and 1.0.9 but doesn't occur on Atom 1.0.7.  No error messages are shown in DevTools' Console.

Adding `--safe` option and resetting Config, Init Script, Keymap, Snippets, and Stylesheet don't change anything.  The problem still occurs.

This is the screen capture.  I am not dragging.  I just click several times while moving the cursor on the editor.  Though there's no cursor in the movie, it is capture app's issue.

![output2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/515636/9594352/fb08c5b0-5094-11e5-92c4-806b78904426.gif)

data.title: Normalize drive letter case on windows
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8551

data.title: cannot type a closing brace }
data.body:
Hi,

I'm on Windows 10, using a French azerty keyboard and whenever I type this key: "}" (which is AltGr +) it either does nothing or folds a section of the code which obviously is not what I want. I have to use copy/paste for this character :)

I have this issue while typing JS or PHP or CSS...

This error occurs regardless of whether `atom` is passed a file, although the _very_ first time I called it with file, Atom didn't crash to the inspector but rather displayed a normal error message. Atom shouldn't fail to open when run from Git bash.

data.title: Pressing esc on multiple cursors returns to original cursor or selection
data.body:
closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7738

Now, when you have multiple cursors or selections and press `esc`, the single cursor or selection that will remain is the original cursor/selection 

![cursors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5764316/9586715/b39de780-501e-11e5-8a1b-03639e92c25d.gif)

data.title: Atom has many unavailable menus with no windows open
data.body: It sure would be nice if more (most) of Atom's menus were available with no window open. One such case would be using project-manager to open a project if it had a sub-menu in the Packages menu.

data.title: ctrl-alt-b conflicts with `build` package
data.body:
Recently, `Atom` takes the key `ctrl-alt-b` for `editor:move-to-previous-subword-boundary` (https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/keymaps/emacs.cson#L7). This conflicts with the [`build` package I am maintaining](https://atom.io/packages/build).

Would it make more sense to have an `emacs-mode` package for people who wants this? This would be akin to the `vim-mode` package which adds `vim` functionalitites to `Atom`.

Right now I am getting reports this keymap takes precedence over mine (https://github.com/noseglid/atom-build/issues/168). Doesn't seem to be that way for everyone though.

data.title: Append root to local cache dir value
data.body:
I believe the wrong variable was being used when this code got ported in #8433 

Closes #8579

/cc @maxbrunsfeld :eyes:

data.title: Add extra columns in the editor view/frame after the line ends
data.body:
When editing lines that go beyond the viewing frame (scrolling to the right), at the end of the line sometimes all the columns are not shown. This seems to be a bug. I will try to take a screenshot of when it happens next. Most editors add a few more columns in the frame to make it easier to edit.

Atom:
See how it ends right after the last character (f)
![screen shot 2015-08-31 at 12 06 11 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11443695/9583430/460c4af8-4fd9-11e5-9249-cb97edbcb3f2.png)

Vertical scroll bars overlaps the character
![screen shot 2015-08-31 at 12 12 00 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11443695/9583484/99d12f28-4fd9-11e5-9f3f-1181672b9f12.png)

Sublime:
See how there is an extra column after the last character (f)
![screen shot 2015-08-31 at 12 06 49 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11443695/9583458/6833c732-4fd9-11e5-9ed6-d4b30434be59.png)

data.title: Upgrade to Squirrel 1.0 on Windows
data.body: Several fixes documented at https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Windows/releases/tag/1.0.0

data.title: Does not properly detect file deletions when switching branches
data.body:
When switching Git branches in Windows, if:
- a file is present in the original branch, but not in the branch I am switching to
- that file is open in the text editor

Atom will throw a warning that it can no longer read the file (since it no longer exists), as opposed to either closing the file or just marking it as unsaved.  Is there any way that atom could detect that this change was caused by Git and handle it more gracefully?

Warning text: "Unable to read file after file change event.
Make sure you have permission to access
[file]."
Platform: Windows 7
Atom Version: 1.0.8

data.title: Find/Replace duplication via Regex
data.body:
I've noticed in the past few versions of Atom that Find/Replace via Regex now has an unwanted side effect where the replacement value gets duplicated.
### Example:

Here I am simply attempting to add 3 trailing periods to the end of each line:
![regex](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/352182/9582967/d2d1b004-4fc5-11e5-82a6-ca7a8e6e2a9f.gif)
### Expected Result:

> this is a test...
> this is also a test...
> this may or may not be a test...
### Actual Result:

The resulting trailing periods are actually 6, instead of 3:

> this is a test......
> this is also a test......
> this may or may not be a test......
### Versions

Confirmed on latest Atom v1.0.9, and a few releases before this.
OS X 10.10.4

data.title: z-index issue for autocomplete suggestions
data.body:
To reproduce, just write something to get the autocomplete list to show, then scroll down. This is on OS X 10.9.5. I would expect the autocomplete list to be hidden when the line it belongs to is no longer visible. This happens in atom 1.0.8 
![atom bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3502769/9582056/21515f08-4fd1-11e5-87c3-0d8918c280ec.gif)

data.title: customFileTypes not overriding default file types
data.body:
Per #8144 I would expect to be able to set a custom file type association to override the default syntax. Here's my `config.cson`:

![atom_customfiletypes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6248612/9579239/b967be74-4fb6-11e5-9be0-6d59c3d06545.png)

Based on [this block in grammars-spec.coffee](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/spec/grammars-spec.coffee#L141-L152) I would expect that my config above would use the `.scss` syntax on `.css` files, but I am not seeing that behavior. Am I reading this incorrectly or doing something wrong?

I am running Atom v1.0.9 on OS X v 10.10.4

cc: @maxbrunsfeld

data.title: San Francisco on El Capitan
data.body:
3ac69500b0627067db59ea60f02f456fee6791be

`font-family: 'SF UI Text'` is not working on El Capitan Beta 15A263e
`font-family: '.SFNSText-Regular'` does work.

data.title: Cant open folder mounted locally with sshfs
data.body:
Cant open remote folder mounted with "sudo sshfs -o allow_other ....." .
Sublime and others -  can.
Just receive Editor is not responding message.
Linux.

data.title: Need a way to disable auto-updates -- extremely unfriendly with slow internet
data.body:
I just had to block Atom's access to the internet in order to actually get anything done.
- I'm in Indonesia, internet here sucks in most places
- There's an atom update out and whenever atom is open is _always_ tries to download this update
- It's using 100% of my bandwidth to attempt to download a file that will _never_ succeed
- My internet basically goes from slow-as-a-turtle to non-existent because of this
- I can't disable it

Please provide a way to disable auto-updates.

data.title: atom-panel does not respect editor font setups
data.body:
`atom-panel` objects does not respect `*.editor.fontFamily` setups in `config.cson`, which together with issue #6214 is causing Chinese (and possibly other nonlatin characters) not displaying correctly in the application.

In #6214, setting up a Chinese font in  `*.editor.fontFamily` in `config.cson` solves Chinese displaying problems, but this issue causes fonts in panels not readable even though these options are setup as mentioned above.

Some screenshots:

![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1768423/9574431/6f7ec67a-4ff9-11e5-9e80-d16dc2499831.png)

The font in the mini-editor and the font in the list are apparently not the same.

![screen2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1768423/9574482/fe793df6-4ff9-11e5-8b50-61bd6ff4b928.png)

Chinese font not displaying correctly in tree-view panel.

![screen3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1768423/9573268/e0ac1e4a-4fec-11e5-8f4f-f6f1615a5430.png)

Chinese font not displaying correctly in clipboard panel from package aki77/atom-clipboard-plus, already reported as aki77/atom-clipboard-plus#6

My system:

```
Version 1.0.7
OS: Linux 64bit
Distro: Arch Linux
Package: atom-editor-bin
```

I don't know if this is a bug or an intended behavior, but I suggest that it though may not be a brilliant idea to make all `atom-panel`s using the same font setup from `*.editor.fontFamily`, cause the setup may be mainly mean to set the **editor** interface font, but adding another option that could change these fonts in other components of the interface is surely a good idea and should be welcomed.

atom/tree-view#501 may be related to this issue.

_For these who come up with the same problem as me_, here's a **workaround**:

Adding these lines to `styles.less`

``` less
atom-panel {
  font-family: "Liberation Mono", "WenQuanYi Micro Hei Mono" !important;
  // Replace with preferred fonts.
}
```

However, there may be some panels that use components like `<pre>` `<code>`, which has explicit font-family override rules in `bootstrap.css` or other stylesheets, and these rules will cause these components not accepting the generic rules we added above, so they should be specified alone:( Taking clipboard panel from aki77/atom-clipboard-plus, which uses `<pre>` for example )

``` less
atom-panel.clipboard-plus .select-list ol.list-group li pre{
  font-family: "Liberation Mono", "WenQuanYi Micro Hei Mono" !important;
}
```
